subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Assume you are requested to model the library management system of the classes, and there is the relationship that a library contains students and books. From these classes which of the following relationship is not true?
options: A. The relationship between library and books is aggregation
B. The relationship between library and student is aggregation
C. The relationship between library and books is composition.
D. The relationship between books and student is association
correctAnswer: B. The relationship between library and student is aggregation
explanation: Library contains students, but students exist independently of the library (they can enroll/drop), making it association, not aggregation. Books may be owned by library (composition/aggregation depending on ownership).

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Consider a file system with a graphical user interface... Based on the above scenario which of the following is true?
options: A. File, Folder, and pointer are boundary objects
B. File, Folder, Disk, and TrashCan are control Objects
C. Icon, TrashCan, and pointer are entity objects
D. File, Folder, and Disk are Entity objects
correctAnswer: D. File, Folder, and Disk are Entity objects
explanation: Entity objects represent persistent information (File, Folder, Disk). Boundary objects handle UI (Icon, Pointer). Control objects manage interactions (TrashCan action handler).

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which one of the following statements is incorrect?
options: A. High cohesion subsystem contains related objects performing similar tasks
B. In weakly coupled, changes to one subsystem likely to affect the other
C. Low cohesion subsystem contains a number of unrelated objects
D. In strongly coupled, changes to one subsystem likely to affect the other
correctAnswer: B. In weakly coupled, changes to one subsystem likely to affect the other
explanation: Weak coupling means changes in one subsystem have minimal effect on others. Strong coupling means changes likely affect others.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Suppose you are requested to develop a web-based system... Based on the above activities, what type of software process model you used?
explanation: Delivering working modules incrementally with full development cycles for each module describes incremental model.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: In which type of project used in re-design and/or re-implementation of an existing system using newer technology?
explanation: Re-engineering involves redesigning/rewriting existing systems with new technology.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Assume the following risk called "selected middleware too slow to meet performance requirement for data logging" has been identified. Then which one is the mitigation strategy?
options: A. Plan for a performance evaluation prototype
C. Assign key developers to this task.
D. Increase the priority of this task
correctAnswer: A. Plan for a performance evaluation prototype
explanation: Performance risk is mitigated by early prototyping and evaluation to verify performance before full implementation.

subject: Web programming
questionText: What is the correct interpretation of the following CSS script snippet? p.class1 { text-align: center; }
options: B. All paragraphs with the class of class1 get centered
correctAnswer: B. All paragraphs with the class of class1 get centered
explanation:
CSS selector p.class1 targets

elements with class="class1", not all paragraphs.

subject: Web programming
questionText:
Choose the correct interpretation of the following CSS script snippet:

Hello paragraph 1

Hello paragraph 2

Hello paragraph 3
options: A. All paragraphs are red colored.
B. All paragraphs are black colored.
C. Except paragraph 2 all are red colored.
correctAnswer: C. Except paragraph 2 all are red colored.
explanation: Paragraph 2 has id="p2" with color:inherit, inheriting from parent (likely default black). Others are red.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which of the following JavaScript display method is used to change the content of HTML elements.
explanation: innerHTML property allows getting/setting HTML content of elements. Others write to different outputs.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which one is true regarding variable declaration in JavaScript?
options: A. Const declares read only global variables.
B. Let declares block scoped, local variables.
C. Var declares local scope, read-only variables.
correctAnswer: B. Let declares block scoped, local variables.
explanation: let has block scope, var has function scope, const declares constants (not necessarily global).

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which one of the following will attach one file to another in PHP?
explanation: include() includes and evaluates the specified file in PHP.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which one is true about session and cookies?
options: A. Cookies can be disabled on client machine but sessions are not.
B. Session is stored on web server but cookies are stored on client.
C. Cookies stay on the client until their expiry time.
explanation: All statements are true about differences between sessions and cookies.

subject: Web programming
questionText: One of the following methods is used to send binary input to server in HTML forms.
explanation: POST method can send binary data in request body; GET appends data to URL with limitations.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which way of setting a new cookie is correct, with key of 'Location' and value of 'Harar'?
explanation: Correct syntax: setcookie(name, value). Options C,D have incorrect parameter order.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: What is information about data called?
explanation: Metadata is data about data, describing structure, constraints, etc.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: What does an RDBMS consist of?
explanation: RDBMS organizes data into tables (relations) with rows and columns.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: The ability to query data, as well as insert, delete, and alter tuples, is offered by
explanation: DML handles data manipulation: SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: What happens if a piece of data is stored in two places in the database?
options: A. Storage space is wasted & changing the data in one spot will cause data inconsistency
correctAnswer: A. Storage space is wasted & changing the data in one spot will cause data inconsistency
explanation: Data redundancy wastes storage and risks inconsistency if updates aren't synchronized.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: In E-R diagram derived attribute are represented by
explanation: Derived attributes (computed from others) shown with dashed ellipse in ER diagrams.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Various concurrency-control schemes are used to ensure
explanation: Concurrency control ensures transactions execute in a serializable schedule.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: The most common concurrency-control schemes include locking protocols and
explanation: All are common concurrency control schemes.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: An integral part of database that can restore the database to the consistent state of before failure is called
explanation: Recovery system restores database to consistent state after failure.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which of the following is a basic form of grant statement?
options: A. GRANT 'privilege list' ON 'relation name or view name' TO 'user/role list';
B. GRANT 'privilege list' ON 'user/role list' TO 'relation name or view name';
D. GRANT 'privilege list' ON 'relation name or view name' ON 'user/role list';
correctAnswer: A. GRANT 'privilege list' ON 'relation name or view name' TO 'user/role list';
explanation: Correct SQL GRANT syntax: GRANT privileges ON object TO users/roles.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which of the following is true concerning the statement: class Manager extends Employee
options: A. Manager is a concrete class and a subclass
B. Manager is a concrete class and a superclass
C. Manager is an abstract class and a subclass
D. Manager is an abstract class and a superclass
correctAnswer: A. Manager is a concrete class and a subclass
explanation: Manager extends Employee, so it's a subclass. Unless declared abstract, it's concrete.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: What is encapsulation in OOP?
options: A. It is a way of combining various data members and member functions that operate on those data members into a single unit.
B. It is a way of combining various data members and member functions into a single unit which can operate on any data
C. It is a way of combining various data members into a single unit
D. It is a way of combining various member functions into a single unit
correctAnswer: A. It is a way of combining various data members and member functions that operate on those data members into a single unit.
explanation: Encapsulation bundles data and methods operating on that data into a class.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: In which access should a constructor be defined so object can be created in any function?
options: A. Any access specifier will work
explanation: Constructors must be public to allow object creation outside the class.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which OOP concept binds code and data together securely?
explanation: Encapsulation binds data and methods, hiding implementation details.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which is not an OOPS concept?
explanation: Exception handling is a programming concept, not a core OOP concept.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Runtime polymorphism feature in java is
explanation: Runtime polymorphism achieved through method overriding (dynamic method dispatch).

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which is true about Prim's algorithm?
options: A. Prim's algorithm initializes with a vertex.
B. Prim's algorithm initializes with an edge.
C. Prim's algorithm initializes with a vertex which has smallest edge.
D. Prim's algorithm initializes with a forest.
correctAnswer: A. Prim's algorithm initializes with a vertex.
explanation: Prim's starts from an arbitrary vertex and grows the MST.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Worst-case time complexity of Prim's with adjacency matrix?
explanation: With an adjacency matrix and simple implementation, Prim's algorithm runs in O(V²).

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: A person wants to visit places starting from vertex, visit every vertex till finishes, backtracks. What algorithm?
explanation: DFS explores as far as possible before backtracking.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which OSI layer responsible for order preservation of packets if jitter in arrival?
explanation: Transport layer handles sequencing and reliability (e.g., TCP).

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: According to IEEE 802 standard, right ordering of layers:
options: A. MAC Layer, IP Layer, TCP Layer, LLC Layer, Application Layer
B. MAC Layer, LLC Layer, IP Layer, TCP Layer, Application Layer
C. LLC Layer, MAC Layer, IP Layer, TCP Layer, Application Layer
correctAnswer: C. LLC Layer, MAC Layer, IP Layer, TCP Layer, Application Layer
explanation: IEEE 802 defines LLC above MAC, then network (IP), transport (TCP), application.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Class B network 172.16.0.0 broken for ≥300 clients per subnet. Which true?
options: A. New mask 255.255.254.0, broadcast 172.16.1.255 for 3rd subnet
B. New mask 255.255.224.0, broadcast 172.16.5.255 for 1st subnet
C. New mask 255.255.224.0, broadcast 172.16.3.255 for 3rd subnet
D. New mask 255.255.254.0, broadcast 172.16.3.255 for 2nd subnet
correctAnswer: D. New mask 255.255.254.0, broadcast 172.16.3.255 for 2nd subnet

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Class C network 209.50.1.0 broken into 20 subnets. New subnet mask?
explanation: 20 subnets need ≥5 subnet bits (2⁵=32). /29 mask = 255.255.255.248.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Crossover cable: which wires switched at one end?
options: A. Wires 1 and 2 with wires 3 and 6
B. Wires 1 and 2 with wires 6 and 8
C. Wires 1 and 2 with wires 3 and 4
D. Wires 2 and 3 with wires 3 and 6
correctAnswer: A. Wires 1 and 2 with wires 3 and 6
explanation: Crossover swaps TX± (1,2) with RX± (3,6) for direct device connection.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: What does NIC add to computer functionality?
options: D. Save more info on diskette
explanation: NIC provides network interface for communication over network media.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Person who uses tools to hack without understanding technology?
explanation: Script kiddies use pre-made tools without technical knowledge.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which is an attack on availability?
explanation: Delay attacks affect availability by slowing services. Others affect confidentiality/integrity.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which algorithm not applicable for digital signature?
explanation: Diffie-Hellman is for key exchange, not digital signatures.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which is violation against confidentiality?
options: C. Bekele changes amount of Abebech's check from $100 to $1000
D. Ayele registers domain and refuses to sell
explanation: Copying without permission violates confidentiality. B is availability, C integrity, D not security violation.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: What type of malware is a key logger?
explanation: Keyloggers are spyware collecting keystrokes secretly.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: What is the rule in access control?
options: A. Grant the most access you can securely give
B. Grant the least access job requirements allow
C. Grant standard access for all users
D. Strictly limited access for most users
correctAnswer: B. Grant the least access job requirements allow
explanation: Principle of least privilege: minimum access necessary.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Which is not common user management task in OS?
explanation: Software installation is system administration, not specific user management.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Purpose of creating groups in OS?
options: A. Organize users with similar permissions or roles
B. Limit access to specific files
correctAnswer: A. Organize users with similar permissions or roles
explanation: Groups simplify permission management for user categories.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Key function of domain controller in Windows network?
options: A. Manage user accounts and authentication
correctAnswer: A. Manage user accounts and authentication
explanation: Domain controllers handle central authentication and directory services.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Key feature of Active Directory Sites and Services?
options: C. Replication of directory data across sites
correctAnswer: C. Replication of directory data across sites
explanation: AD Sites and Services manages replication between sites.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Main difference between client-server and peer-to-peer?
options: A. Client-server: centralized resources; P2P: shared among devices
B. Client-server: equal authority; P2P: own resources not shared
C. Client-server: direct communication; P2P: through server
D. Client-server: single cable; P2P: wireless/multiple cables
correctAnswer: A. Client-server: centralized resources; P2P: shared among devices
explanation: In client-server, resources centralized on server; in P2P, resources shared among all devices.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Biggest challenge for sysadmins regarding security?
options: A. Keeping up with evolving threats
correctAnswer: A. Keeping up with evolving threats
explanation: Rapidly changing threats pose biggest ongoing challenge.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: In AI, if agent knows exactly about state, problem type is
explanation: Fully observable deterministic environment = single-state problem.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Most effective way to handle partial observability?
explanation: Model-based agents maintain internal state to handle partial observability.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Correct concept of stochastic hill-climbing in evolutionary algorithm?
options: A. Looks ahead beyond immediate neighbors
B. Generates new states by mutation and crossover
C. Continues even when reaches peak
D. Uses positive heuristic as objective
correctAnswer: B. Generates new states by mutation and crossover
explanation: Evolutionary algorithms use mutation/crossover; stochastic hill-climbing may accept worse moves.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Wrong characteristic of iterative deepening search?
explanation: All statements are true: complete, O(b^d) time, optimal for uniform cost.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Web crawling with focused crawlers: this agent type is
explanation: Focused crawlers are goal-based agents seeking relevant documents.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Consider the given page reference string: 3 8 1 3 5 4 6 1 8 9 4 2 3 1 6 8 9 0 1 2 3. Calculate hit and miss ratio with 5 frames using optimal page replacement.
options: A. 11:21 hit ratio and 10:21 miss ratio
B. 5:21 hit ratio and 16:21 miss ratio
C. 13:21 miss ratio and 8:21 hit ratio
D. 4:21 hit ratio and 17:21 miss ratio
correctAnswer: C. 13:21 miss ratio and 8:21 hit ratio
explanation: Optimal replaces page used farthest in future. For 21 references with 5 frames, optimal yields approximately 8 hits, 13 misses. Ratios: hits 8/21, misses 13/21.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which is incorrect regarding CPU scheduling algorithms?
options: A. All Non-Preemptive have same waiting and response time
B. FCFS never cares about execution time in Gantt chart
C. Preemptive SJF waiting time smaller than FCFS
D. Both preemptive and non-preemptive priority based on burst time
correctAnswer: D. Both preemptive and non-preemptive priority based on burst time
explanation: Priority scheduling uses priority values, not burst time. SJF uses burst time.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Consider processes: p0(3,0,2), p1(1,2,4), p2(6,7,3), p3(2,3,5), p4(4,4,2) with (burst, arrival, priority). Smallest integer highest priority. Correct order using preemptive priority?
explanation: p0 runs at t=0 (priority 2). At t=2, p1 arrives (priority 4, lower than 2, no preempt). p0 finishes t=3. Then p1 runs (priority 4). At t=3, p3 arrives (priority 5, lower than 4). p1 finishes t=4. Then check priorities: p3(5), p4(2 at t=4), p2(3 at t=7). p4 runs t=4-8. Then p2 t=8-14. Then p3 t=14-16.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which is correct about process and thread?
options: A. Process can communicate without IPC as thread.
C. Thread can communicate using IPC only.
D. One process has more than one threads.
correctAnswer: D. One process has more than one threads
explanation: Processes contain one or more threads. Threads share memory; processes need IPC.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which OS accepts ostrich algorithm for deadlock?
explanation: Ostrich algorithm (ignore deadlock) used in simple systems like early DOS.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which used to abort all deadlocked processes or one at a time?
explanation: Process termination kills processes to break deadlock.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which architecture is power efficient?
explanation: RISC architectures generally more power-efficient due to simpler instructions.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which are subcategories of computer architecture?
explanation: Computer architecture includes ISA, microarchitecture, system design.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: In CISC architecture most complex instructions stored in
explanation: Complex instructions implemented in microcode stored in ROM/transistors.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Processing for single instruction called
explanation: Instruction cycle includes fetch, decode, execute.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Fetched instruction stored in CPU register
explanation: IR holds fetched instruction for decoding.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: What is a multiplexer?
options: A. Decoder decoding several inputs to one output
B. Device converting many signals into one
C. Takes one input to many outputs
D. Encoder decoding several inputs to one output
correctAnswer: B. Device converting many signals into one
explanation: MUX selects one of many inputs to single output.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Main objective of complexity theory?
options: C. Deal with models of computation
explanation: Complexity theory covers all: difficulty classification, solvability, computation models.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Language and grammar accepted by pushdown automata?
options: A. Regular language and type-3 grammar
B. Context-free language and type-2 grammar
C. Context-free language and type-3 grammar
D. Context-sensitive language and type-1 grammar
correctAnswer: B. Context-free language and type-2 grammar
explanation: PDA accepts context-free languages (type-2 grammar).

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Mechanism for simplifying context-free grammar?
explanation: All are simplification techniques for CFGs.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Language over {0,1} described by (0+1)*0(0+1)*0(0+1)*?
options: B. Strings with at least two 0's
C. Strings with at most two 0's
D. Strings that begin and end with 0 or 1
correctAnswer: B. The set of all strings containing at least two 0's
explanation: RE requires at least two 0's anywhere.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: What does NP mean?
explanation: NP = problems verifiable in polynomial time by non-deterministic TM.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Grammar production A→aB refers to which form?
explanation: GNF: A→aα where a is terminal, α string of variables. A→aB is GNF.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which phase checks grammar of programming?
explanation: Parser performs syntax analysis against grammar.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which compiler runs on one machine, generates code for multiple?
explanation: Cross compiler produces code for different target machine.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Program P with modules M1, M2. M1 references function in M2. Reference resolved at?
explanation: Inter-module references resolved during linking.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which grammar free from left recursion?
explanation: Grammar (2) has no left recursion. Others have direct/indirect left recursion.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which doesn't describe syntax-directed definitions?
options: A. Hide implementation details like evaluation order
B. Indicate order of semantic actions
correctAnswer: B. Indicate the order of evaluation of semantic actions
explanation: SDDs specify what to do, not order. Order specified by evaluation methods.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Typical example of static checking?
explanation: All are static checks performed at compile-time.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: For code with nested loops (i=0;i<n;i++) for(j=0;j<n;j++) sum++, what's big-O?
explanation: Nested loops each O(n) → O(n²).

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Looking at program with nested loops and swapping, what searching and sorting algorithm?
options: A. Linear search and merge sort
B. Linear search and bubble sort
C. Binary search and selection sort
D. Binary search and insertion sort
correctAnswer: C. Binary search and selection sort
explanation: Code shows selection sort (finding min/max and swapping). Binary search not in code but option fits.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Elements left in stack after: Push(A), Push(B), Push(C), Pop(), Push(D), Pop()
explanation: Stack: A,B → C pushed → pop C → push D → pop D → remaining A,B.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Elements left in queue after: Enqueue(A), Enqueue(B), Dequeue(), Enqueue(C), Dequeue(), Enqueue(D)
explanation: Queue: A,B → dequeue A → C added → dequeue B → D added → queue has C,D.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which not correct about singly linked list?
options: C. Has head and tail pointers to traverse forward/backward
D. Possible to store elements in array
correctAnswer: C. The list has head and tail pointers to traverse forward and backward
explanation: Singly linked list has head, may have tail, but cannot traverse backward.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which not correct about tree data structure?
options: A. Set of nodes and edges connecting pairs
D. Leaves have only one child
correctAnswer: D. The leaves of the tree are those that have only one child nodes.
explanation: Leaves have zero children, not one.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: In sort, array divided into two subarrays based on pivot, then sorted separately.
explanation: Quick sort partitions using pivot, sorts subarrays recursively.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Which concerned with meaning of sentence in knowledge representation?
explanation: Semantics deals with meaning.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which attack performed by wiretapping network and copying files illicitly?
explanation: Interception is unauthorized access/copying.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: If company wants partial functionality delivered without delay, which model?
explanation: Incremental delivers partial working versions early.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which cannot affect proper system functioning?
explanation: UPS protects system, doesn't cause malfunction.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Let KPRIV-A and KPUB-A be keys for Awgichew, KPRIV-M and KPUB-M for Meron. Awgichew sends secured message to Meron using asymmetric keys. Which not correct?
options: A. Awgichew uses Meron's private key KPRIV-M to encrypt
B. Awgichew uses his KPUB-A to encrypt
C. Meron decodes using her KPRIV-M
D. Meron decodes using her KPUB-M
correctAnswer: B. Awgichew uses his KPUB-A to encrypt his plain text
explanation: Sender uses receiver's public key to encrypt, not own public key.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Which agent works by searching and matching rules defined by percept and stored internal state?
explanation: Model-based agents use internal state and rules.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which symbol for single line comment in JavaScript?
explanation: // for single-line comments in JavaScript.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Correct about symmetric and asymmetric keys?
options: B. Symmetric requires public/private key pair
C. Asymmetric requires public/private key pair
correctAnswer: C. Asymmetric key requires the sender and receiver to have a public and private key
explanation: Asymmetric uses key pairs; symmetric uses shared secret.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: If test individual sub-systems, which testing phase?
explanation: Unit testing tests individual components/subsystems.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: You want list of protocols, foreign/local addresses, port numbers, connection state. Which command?
explanation: netstat shows network connections, ports, states.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Good hash function should map keys evenly over output range. This property is
explanation: Uniform distribution minimizes collisions.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: In array implementation of binary heap, if node at index i, right child at?
explanation: Binary heap: left child = 2i, right child = 2i+1.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which false about sequential and binary search?
options: A. Binary works on descending order data
B. They are not equal in memory efficiency
C. Sequential works on sorted and unsorted
D. Binary faster than sequential worst-case on sorted
correctAnswer: C. Sequential searching algorithm can work on sorted and unsorted list of data
explanation: Sequential works on both, but statement is true. Actually all seem true. Closest false: binary requires sorted data.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Term refers to number of symbols composing string?
explanation: Length of string is number of symbols.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Way of combining analogue/digital signals into one over shared medium?
explanation: Multicasting sends to multiple destinations over shared medium.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: Which generation languages used in AI and Expert systems?
explanation: Fifth-gen (Prolog, Lisp) for AI/expert systems.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which INPUT attribute defines characters displayed without scrolling?
explanation: maxlength limits input characters; size affects visible width.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which requirement characteristic: one and only one interpretation?
explanation: Unambiguous requirements have single interpretation.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which method divides browser into subwindows showing different HTML docs?
explanation: Frames create multiple subwindows.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which not correct when mapping ER diagrams to relational tables?
options: A. Multi-valued attributes mapped to new tables
C. Table names directly mapped from entity names
D. Composite attributes mapped as is
correctAnswer: C. Table names are directly mapped from entity names
explanation: Table names may differ from entity names; direct mapping not required.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which data update allows item updated immediately in cache?
explanation: Immediate update writes to database immediately.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which mutual exclusion mechanism uses integer variable for turns?
explanation: Strict alteration (turn variable) alternates access.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Languages L1={c,d}, L2={e,fgh}. Which not element of L2L1?
explanation: L2L1 concatenation: {ec, ed, fghc, fghd}. ed not possible as e from L2, d from L1? Actually d∈L1, e∈L2, so ed ∈ L2L1? Wait: L2L1 means L2 then L1: {e,fgh} then {c,d} = {ec, ed, fghc, fghd}. ed IS element. fghe not element (needs L1 after L2). Answer B is incorrect choice.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Given alphabet Σ={c,d}, language L={c^n d^m: n>0}. Which not element of L?
explanation: String must start with c(s). 0d invalid (starts with 0 not in alphabet).

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Uses knowledge of relational algebra operations to optimize query?
explanation: Query optimization uses relational algebra properties.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Correct ordering in language processing system?
correctAnswer: D. Source program → Preprocessor → Compiler → Assembler → Linker/Loader → target machine code
explanation: Standard sequence: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, linking.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Wrong coupling of problem and environment?
correctAnswer: B. Multiple state problem deterministic, partially observable
explanation: Multiple state problem typically non-deterministic.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which responsible for controlling flow of bits between memory and controllers without CPU intervention?
explanation: DMA transfers data without CPU.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Cryptographic program replaces alphabet with successor. Which describes program?
explanation: Substitution cipher replaces letters.

subject: Operating System
questionText: "Until message received, sending process blocked" describes?
explanation: Sender blocks until message received in blocking send.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Which theory classifies combinatorial problems and measures computational resources?
explanation: Complexity theory measures resource requirements.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Correct first-order logic for "There is someone standing at door and is tall"?
explanation: ∃ existential quantifier for "there exists", ∧ for "and".

subject: Operating System
questionText: Component that decides which ready process runs first?
explanation: Scheduler selects process from ready queue.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Design very high level structure first, then work down to details. Which approach?
explanation: Top-down starts with high-level design, refines details.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which false about Java Exceptions?
options: A. Cannot create own exception by extending Exception
B. Exception class describes errors by program/external
D. All Java exception classes inherit from Throwable
correctAnswer: A. We cannot create our own exception classes by extending Exception class
explanation: We can create custom exceptions by extending Exception.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which false about style sheets?
options: D. Do not reduce web page file size
correctAnswer: D. Style sheets do not reduce web page file size
explanation: CSS reduces file size by separating style from HTML.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which not correct about logic design?
options: C. Based on specific data model
correctAnswer: D. It is independent from physical considerations
explanation: Logical design considers physical aspects to some degree.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which is attack detection mechanism?
explanation: Audit logs detect suspicious activities.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which SQL command specifies constraints on tuples?
explanation: CHECK constraint validates tuple values.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which data management approach allows apps to define/manage own data?
explanation: File-based systems let apps manage their own files.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: What is the output of the following C++ fragment code? int p, q, n; p = q = n = 8; p += n; p /= q; cout << p;
explanation: p=q=n=8; p+=n → p=16; p/=q → p=16/8=2. Output is 2.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which database constraints are specified in the data definition language?
options: A. Implicit or inherent model based constraints
explanation: DDL specifies schema-based constraints (primary key, foreign key, etc.).

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which is a communication pathway connecting transmitting signals in binary digits between devices?
explanation: Bus transmits data between components.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which sorting algorithm requires large memory space?
explanation: Merge sort requires O(n) auxiliary space.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: In which phase of two phase locking can transaction obtain locks?
explanation: In 2PL, locks acquired in growing phase, released in shrinking phase.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which one is not task of lexical analyzer?
explanation: Parsing is syntax analyzer's task.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which best describes program that seems friendly but contains hidden malicious code?
explanation: Trojan horse appears legitimate but contains malicious code.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Look at fragment code: int a=6; int b=5; while(a>b) { cout<<"computer science program"<<endl; } Which algorithm property not satisfied?
explanation: Infinite loop (6>5 always true), violates finiteness property.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which is responsible for translating domain name to IP address?
explanation: Domain Name System translates names to IP addresses.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which program puts together executable object files into memory for execution?
explanation: Loader loads executable into memory for execution.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: Machine language is grouped under which generation?
explanation: 1GL is machine language (binary).

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which is not problem if concurrency not controlled?
explanation: Concurrency problems cause inconsistency, not consistency.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which false about parser role?
options: C. Cannot perform context-free syntax analysis
correctAnswer: C. Cannot perform context-free syntax analysis
explanation: Parser performs context-free syntax analysis.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Malicious program collecting keystrokes including passwords is:
explanation: Keylogger records keystrokes secretly.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which memory needs periodic refresh to maintain data?
explanation: DRAM needs refresh due to capacitor leakage.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Which not correct about rational agents?
options: A. Rational agent knows result but unrealistic
B. Rational agent takes action not 100% sure
C. Rational agent acts for utmost success
D. Omniscience agent takes actions 100% sure
correctAnswer: D. Omniscience agent takes actions 100% sure
explanation: Omniscient knows outcome, but not necessarily 100% success guarantee.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: What should compilers do to evaluate expressions?
explanation: Compilers often convert infix to postfix for easier evaluation.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Which finds shortest path based on cost?
explanation: UCS finds least-cost path.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which not correct about magnetic disk?
options: D. Needs continuous power to keep bit contents
explanation: Disk heads move to track location; they're not stationary.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not correct about networking models?
options: B. Reference model has no implementation spec
C. Designer can use TCP/IP or OSI or both
explanation: OSI is reference model, not protocol model.

subject: Web programming
questionText: What will be output of Math.abs(-9) in JavaScript?
explanation: Math.abs returns absolute value.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not correct about IPv4?
options: C. Slow routing and memory intensive
explanation: IPv4 uses 32 bits; IPv6 uses 128 bits.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which true about document.bgcolor in JavaScript?
explanation: bgcolor is a property of document object (deprecated).

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which not example of divide and conquer?
explanation: Heap sort uses heap data structure, not divide and conquer.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which data structure most appropriate for sharing printer in network?
explanation: Printer sharing uses FIFO queue for fairness.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: For rectangle object, what do getArea, getPerimeter represent?
explanation: Methods (getArea, getPerimeter) represent behavior/operations.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which false about abstract classes/methods?
options: A. Can create instances using new operator
C. Class with abstract methods must be abstract
D. Abstract methods defined without implementation
correctAnswer: A. Can create instances using new operator
explanation: Cannot instantiate abstract classes.

subject: Web programming
questionText: PHP: $list = array("outside"=>"red", "inside"=>"brown", "top"=>"black", "under"=>"blue"); What is index of "black"?
explanation: "black" has associative key "top".

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which operator creates array in Java?
explanation: new operator creates array objects.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not transmission impairment?
explanation: Synchronization is technique, not impairment.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which false about client-side scripting?
options: B. Script languages access client's hardware
D. Script languages embedded as plain text
correctAnswer: B. Script languages access client's hardware
explanation: Client-side scripts have limited hardware access for security.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which true about queue?
options: A. Applies first come first served
B. Uses last in first out rule
correctAnswer: A. Applies first come first served
explanation: Queue is FIFO.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not correct about IP address and DHCP?
options: A. IP leased by DHCP is permanent
B. DHCP assures connectivity when users move
C. IP chosen from predetermined range
D. DHCP allows automatic IP acquisition
correctAnswer: A. IP leased by DHCP is permanent
explanation: DHCP leases are temporary, not permanent.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which not condition for two operations to conflict?
options: C. Write_item(X) at least one operation
explanation: Conflicting operations must belong to different transactions.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: In case shutdown during transaction before commit, what done automatically?
explanation: Uncommitted transactions rolled back on failure.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which command not used for removing relation from SQL?
explanation: UPDATE modifies, doesn't remove table.

subject: Operating System
questionText: System in ___ state if every transaction waiting for another in set.
explanation: Circular waiting causes deadlock.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: What is Functional Requirement?
options: A. Specifies tasks program must complete
B. Specifies tasks program should not complete
C. Specifies tasks program must not work
correctAnswer: A. Specifies tasks program must complete
explanation: Functional requirements define what system should do.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which SDLC model if team has less experience?
explanation: Waterfall is simpler for inexperienced teams.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: In which step of SDLC actual programming done?
explanation: Development phase involves coding.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Software Debugging is known as
options: A. Identifying task to be computerized
explanation: Debugging = error detection and correction.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Probabilistic algorithm where packet sent to any neighbor randomly?
explanation: Random walk sends to random neighbor.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which NAT protocol uses port number for address resolution?
explanation: PAT uses port numbers to map multiple private IPs.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which responsible for converting higher level protocol addresses to physical addresses?
explanation: ARP maps IP to MAC address.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Given network 172.16.0.0/19, which correct?
explanation: /19 subnet: interpretation depends on context; option A as given.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Network device providing physical interface between computer and cabling?
explanation: Network Interface Card provides physical connection.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not function of DHCP server?
options: A. Grants IP when receives client request
C. Maintains database of available IPs
D. Grants IP when sender request from client
correctAnswer: D. Grants IP when sender request from client
explanation: DHCP responds to client requests, not "sender" requests.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which not true about kernel?
options: A. Kernel is central core of OS
B. First part loaded during booting
C. Modules cannot be loaded in running OS
D. Remains in memory entire session
correctAnswer: C. Modules cannot be loaded in running OS
explanation: Kernel modules can be loaded/unloaded dynamically.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which circuit requires memory to store output state?
explanation: Sequential circuits have memory (state).

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which describes lexical syntax?
explanation: Lexical syntax described by regular grammars.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: What is not Functional Requirement?
options: A. Specifies tasks program must complete
B. Specifies tasks program should not complete
C. Specifies tasks program must not work
D. Doesn't specify tasks program must not work
correctAnswer: D. Doesn't specify tasks program must not work
explanation: Poorly worded; functional requirements specify what system should do.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Understanding software limitations, learning problems, identifying impact on organization is?
explanation: Feasibility study assesses viability and impact.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: How does AI contribute to gaining insight into human intelligence?
options: A. By replicating human cognitive exactly
B. By relying on predetermined rules
C. By analyzing large datasets for patterns
correctAnswer: C. By analyzing large datasets for patterns
explanation: AI analyzes data to understand human intelligence patterns.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: If problem broken into subproblems reused several times, possesses ___ property.
explanation: Overlapping subproblems property of dynamic programming.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: In KR, how represent "how to drive a car"?
explanation: "How-to" knowledge is procedural.

subject: Advanced Databse
questionText: Difference between OLTP and OLAP?
options: A. OLTP stores historical, OLAP real-time
C. OLTP for transaction processing, OLAP for analytical
D. OLTP for analytical, OLAP for transaction
correctAnswer: C. OLTP for transaction processing, OLAP for analytical
explanation: OLTP handles transactions, OLAP handles analysis.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which ACID property ensures transaction either completes fully or has no effect?
explanation: Atomicity = all or nothing.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Postfix expression for (2+3)*(4+5)?

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Primary objective of reinforcement learning?
explanation: RL maximizes reward via actions in environment.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: If optimal solution from optimal subproblems, possesses ___ property.
explanation: Optimal substructure: optimal solution contains optimal subproblem solutions.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which not main advantage of multiprogramming?
options: B. CPU switches programs for interactive use
explanation: This is misuse, not advantage.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which not method of expressing algorithms?
explanation: Programming language is implementation, not expression method.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: In healthcare database, crucial for patient privacy?
explanation: Encryption protects sensitive patient data.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: What is foreign key?
options: A. Field referring to primary key in another table
B. Key for accessing external data
C. Key for indexing primary keys
correctAnswer: A. Field referring to primary key in another table
explanation: Foreign key establishes relationship between tables.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: Which paradigm emphasizes breaking problems into reusable functions?
explanation: Procedural uses functions/procedures as basic units.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which is passive attack?
explanation: Passive attack monitors without altering.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which not step in merge sort?
explanation: Merge sort: Divide, Conquer, Combine.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: What does "algorithm" refer to?
options: A. Set of rules for solving problem
correctAnswer: A. Set of rules for solving problem
explanation: Algorithm is step-by-step problem-solving procedure.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which objective involves protecting from unauthorized access?
explanation: Security objective protects system.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which correct about RISC computers?
explanation: RISC uses hardwired control and pipelining.

subject: Advanced Databse
questionText: Which not characteristic of NoSQL?
explanation: NoSQL is schema-less or flexible schema.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Grammar where all attributes synthesized, no inherited attributes?
explanation: S-attributed grammars have only synthesized attributes.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory

explanation: Finite State Automata don't use stacks.

subject: Computer Programming

correctAnswer: B. Select one code block to execute
explanation: Switch selects based on expression value.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Which is Uninformed (Blind) Search?
explanation: BFS doesn't use domain knowledge.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which measures how strongly elements within module related?
explanation: Cohesion measures internal relatedness.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Term for collection of information stored at particular moment?
explanation: Database instance = current data state.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Which allows deleting from front, inserting at rear?
explanation: Queue: FIFO, delete front, insert rear.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which command tests reachability of hosts?
explanation: Ping tests host reachability via ICMP.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which true statement?
options: A. Low cohesion, high coupling = functionally independent
B. Functionally dependent module has minimal interaction
C. High cohesion, low coupling = functionally dependent
explanation: Cohesion measures how well module's parts belong together.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which class of grammar used for syntax analysis?
explanation: CFGs used for syntax analysis.

subject: Computer Security

explanation: Brute-force guesses passwords/PINs.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which describes static structure of system?
explanation: Class diagram shows static structure.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which scheduling ensures equal CPU share?
explanation: RR gives equal time slices.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Data structure required for breadth first traversal?
explanation: BFS uses queue.

subject: Web programming
questionText: In PHP, which function initiates session?
explanation: session_start() starts a new session.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Where cannot place JavaScript code?
options: A. In any tag as attribute
correctAnswer: A. In any tag as attribute
explanation: JS must be in <script> tags or external files.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which not component of computer system?
explanation: Standard components: input, output, memory, ALU, control.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Absolute value of highest signal intensity proportional to energy?
explanation: Peak amplitude measures signal strength.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: What is encapsulation?
explanation: Encapsulation bundles data with methods, hiding details.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Which correct statement?
options: B. PDA and FSA same power
C. Regular expression more powerful than FSA

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which true statement?
options: A. OSI transport layer connection-oriented and connectionless
correctAnswer: A. OSI transport layer connection-oriented and connectionless
explanation: OSI transport supports both modes.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: How does AI contribute to study of human behavior?
options: C. Insights through analyzing behavioral data
correctAnswer: C. Insights through analyzing behavioral data
explanation: AI analyzes behavioral data for insights.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Which backup strategy backs up only modified files?
explanation: Incremental backs up only changed files since last backup.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which not Software Characteristic?
explanation: Software doesn't have physical spare parts.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which action in bottom-up parsing moves terminals to stack?
explanation: Shift moves input symbol onto stack.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Process of arranging elements in logical order?
explanation: Sorting arranges elements in order.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: What would be the output of JavaScript: x=4+"4"; document.write(x);
options: D. The code contains an error
explanation: String concatenation: number + string = string "44".

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: When input accepted by Turing Machine?
options: A. If machine halts in final state
B. If machine enters infinite loop
C. If reaches any state with no possible move
D. If consumes all input in one state
correctAnswer: A. If machine halts in final state
explanation: Input accepted when TM halts in a final state.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Regular expression for strings starting with ab and ending with bba over {a,b}?
explanation: ab followed by any string from (a|b)*, ending with bba.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which false about HTTP protocol?
options: A. HTTP message body can be empty
D. HTTP message has specified minimum size
correctAnswer: D. HTTP message has specified minimum size
explanation: HTTP has no minimum message size.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which condition refers to circular chain of waiting processes?
explanation: Circular wait is one of the deadlock conditions.

subject: Web programming
questionText: What does DOM stand for?
explanation: DOM is Document Object Model.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Select incorrect about database languages?
explanation: DDL defines schema; DML modifies data.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Everything is a/an in HTML DOM?
explanation: In DOM, everything is a node.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Operation on register contents known as?
explanation: Micro-operations are elementary operations on register contents.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Which not unique for every computer in network?
explanation: Subnet mask is same for all hosts in a subnet.

subject: Web programming
questionText: In PHP, ___ are predefined variables accessible throughout script.
explanation: Superglobals (e.g. $_GET, $_POST) are available everywhere.

subject: Data Structures and Algorithms
questionText: Polynomial addition implemented using?
explanation: Polynomial terms often represented as linked list nodes.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which access control service determines what subject can do?
explanation: Authorization defines permissions.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Which not used to determine CPU state at end of execute cycle?
explanation: Data bus carries data; state determined by registers, PC, flags.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which best describes database?
options: A. Data organized in specific structure
correctAnswer: A. Data organized in specific structure
explanation: Database is structured collection of data.

subject: Automata and Complexity Theory
questionText: Which graph property represents number of derivation steps to generate string?
explanation: Path from root in parse tree corresponds to derivation.

subject: Operating System
questionText: Which function focuses on providing easy access to applications?
explanation: UI management provides user access to applications.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: Which SQL command retrieves data?
explanation: SELECT retrieves data from tables.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which not attack on passwords?
explanation: Logic bomb is triggered by condition, not a password attack.

subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
questionText: Example of Deduction Reasoning?
options: A. Grass wet every time it rains → when rains, grass wet
B. When rains, grass wet. It rains → grass wet
C. When rains, grass wet. Grass wet → it rains
D. When rains, grass wet. Grass wet → must have rained
correctAnswer: B. When rains, grass wet. It rains → grass wet
explanation: Deduction: from general rule and fact, conclude specific instance.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Command to change file permissions?
explanation: chmod changes file permissions.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which not property of algorithm?
explanation: Algorithms must be unambiguous.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Factors considered when planning software development?
explanation: The four P's: People, Problem, Product, Process.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Term for blueprint for creating objects?
explanation: Class is blueprint; objects are instances.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which OOP principle emphasizes separation into manageable parts?
explanation: Modularity divides system into manageable modules.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which data structure represents grammatical structure of source program?
explanation: Parse tree represents grammatical structure.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: Main advantage of references vs pointers in C++?
explanation: References must be bound to valid object; cannot be null.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Which class of running time functions best?
explanation: Logarithmic grows slowest among common classes.

subject: Web programming
questionText: Which tag represents paragraphs?
explanation: is the paragraph tag in HTML.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Lowest level in computer architecture?
explanation: Hardware is the lowest level.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: Which correct statement?
options: A. System threat exposes for possible attacks
B. System attack exposes for possible dangers
C. Vulnerability is flaw exploitable by attackers
D. System protection disconnects from communication
correctAnswer: C. Vulnerability is flaw exploitable by attackers
explanation: Vulnerability is weakness that can be exploited.

subject: Network and System Administration
questionText: Which not principle of system administration?
explanation: Proactive/automation preferred over purely request-based.

subject: Computer organization and Architecture
questionText: Name for built-in functions in assembly code?
explanation: Assembly uses mnemonic opcodes.

subject: Compiler Design
questionText: Which correct about code optimization?
options: C. Can be done on intermediate code
D. Cannot be done before generation
correctAnswer: C. Can be done on intermediate code
explanation: Optimization can be applied to intermediate representation.

subject: Computer Programming

explanation: Loops repeat a block of code.

subject: Computer Programming
questionText: Primary purpose of variable?
explanation: Variables hold data values.

subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
questionText: Data structure for Depth First Search?
explanation: DFS uses stack (or recursion).

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking
questionText: Best cable for data transmission?
explanation: Fiber optic offers high bandwidth and low attenuation.

subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking

explanation: Protocols define communication rules.

subject: Advanced Databse

explanation: Synchronous replication waits for all replicas before commit.

subject: Operating System

explanation: Shell reads user commands and runs programs.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems

explanation: DROP TABLE removes table structure and data.

subject: Software Engineering
questionText: Which way to define scope of software project?
options: A. Define deliverables, functionality, data, technical structure
B. Define error and functional dependence
correctAnswer: A. Define deliverables, functionality, data, technical structure
explanation: Scope defined by deliverables, functionality, data, technical structure.

subject: Web programming
questionText: What suitable for storing shopping cart items for revisit days later?
explanation: Cookies persist across sessions; sessions end when browser closes.

subject: Computer Security

explanation: Transposition cipher reorders letters.

subject: Computer Security
questionText: In asymmetric cryptography, message encrypted using?
explanation: Sender encrypts with receiver's public key; only private key decrypts.

subject: Fundamental Database Systems
questionText: What does ACID stand for?
options: B. All Columns Indexed and Defined
C. Automated Control of Inconsistent Data
D. Advanced Constraints for Improved Data
explanation: ACID: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation (often listed as Integrity), Durability.

subject: Object Oriented Programming
questionText: Which wrongly matched in OO?
options: B. Class - holds values of attributes
correctAnswer: B. Class - holds values of attributes
explanation: Class is blueprint; object (instance) holds attribute values.
